channel.title: [Ubuntu] Firefox components (buttons, etc) look horrible! How to fix
channel.description:
[Ubuntu] Firefox components (buttons, etc) look horrible! How to fix.
Tutorial on Installing Firefox Widgets to make Components Sharper! File is at the bottom of this page if you do not want to register. :) http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=369596
Screenshots taken from the page. [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/9933/buttoncomparisonit7.png[/img] [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/4695/checkboxcomparisongb7.png[/img] [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/5641/radiobuttoncomparisonyz0.png[/img] [img]http://img410.imageshack.us/img410/7093/scrollercomparisoniy8.png[/img] [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/4117/textfieldcomparisondz6.png[/img]
Google Before: [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/2541/oldgoogleuz4.png[/img]
Google After: [img]http://img410.imageshack.us/img410/9629/newgooglexq7.png[/img]
Enjoy! Here is the file. http://rapidshare.com/files/34918069/firefox-widgets-1.1.tar.bz2.html
~Ron :D

i cant instal it as its a .exe and it crashes any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: [Ubuntu] Firefox components (buttons, etc) look horrible! How to fix
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yeah… but ever have something that did work but certain aspects of it bothered you? This is the only thing that comes to my mind, but for example, someone I know likes the Microsoft FreeCell more than the Ubuntu FreeCell. It bothered him so much that he used Microsoft instead until I told him about Wine and that you can emulate MS FreeCell.

So… to each his own I suppose.

Read full topic
